byline.contributor: Ivan Nechepurenko contributed reporting from Moscow.

abstract: Officials for 2016 Paralympic Games are moving to bar Russia from competition because of doping violations, unprecedented sanction in history of disabled-athlete sports; recent investigation finds that at least 35 drug violations among Russian Paralympic contenders had been covered up by country’s sports ministry since 2011.

headline.print_headline: Russia’s Team in Paralympics Faces Ban, Too
headline.main: Russia’s Paralympic Team Is Facing a Ban of Its Own

snippet: Olympic officials, meanwhile, said that in retesting urine samples from the 2008 Beijing Games and 2012 London Games, 23 more medalists were tainted....
lead_paragraph: Olympic officials, meanwhile, said that in retesting urine samples from the 2008 Beijing Games and 2012 London Games, 23 more medalists were tainted.
